description: Long-term extension, beyond 2100,  for the SSP1-2.6 scenario.  The rate of negative carbon emissions reached in 2100 is extended to 2150 and then increases linearly to zero in 2200, leading to slowly declining forcing that approximately stabilises in 2200 around 1.5 W/m2. This extension is expected to achieve a long term equilibration temperature of 1.5 degrees C above pre-industrial temperatures.  Concentration-driven.
keywords: ScenarioMIP, Tier 2, Scenario, SSP, RCP, SSP1, RCP2.6 extension, future,  SSP-based RCP
long_name: extension of RCP2.6 based on SSP1
rationale: To investigate long term changes associated with a low forcing scenario. Inform analysis of the implications of the 1.5°C target. To allow investigation of questions related to climate change beyond 2100. To address questions of long term feedbacks and reversibility which might not be apparent from shorter simulations.
